results.title: From Mao to Mozart: Isaac Stern in China
results.creator_credit: Murray Lerner and Harmony Film Group
results.brief_description: Isaac Stern and his family visited China for three weeks in 1989 as the guests of the Foreign Minister. Stern visits schools and conservatories of music, giving master classes and concerts, and speaking to music teachers who lived through the Cultural revolution.
results.title_for_label: From Mao to Mozart: Isaac Stern in China

results.title: The Music man
results.creator_credit: Morton Da Costa and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A con artist arrives in River City, Iowa with the intention of duping the townspeople into forming a marching band and acquiring band equipment and musical expertise from him - at a price. He does not have a musical bone in his body however, so the band is unlikely to reach fruition. His plan begins to unravel when he falls for Marion (Shirley Jones), a librarian living in River City. This is the rather simplistic plot that provides a backdrop to the many song and dance routines. Robert Preston reprises his Broadway role as con artist “Professor” Harold Hill. Shirley Jones plays the role performed on stage by Barbara Cook. Includes hits such as “Ya got trouble”, “Till there was you”, “Marion the librarian” and “Seventy six trombones”. Cast also includes Buddy Hackett, Hermione Gingold and Paul Ford. The tape also includes a documentary about the making of ‘The Music man’ - “Right here in River City: the making of ‘The Music Man’”, as well as the original theatrical trailer and an introduction by Shirley Jones.

results.title: The Man who came to dinner
results.creator_credit: William Keighley, Hal B. Wallis and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: While on a lecture tour an acid-tongued celebrity (Whiteside) and his secretary accept a dinner invitation from the Stanleys. Unfortunately on arriving at the Stanley’s home, Whiteside slips on the ice and breaks his hip subsequently finding himself confined to the Stanley’s home. During his recuperation Whiteside manages to cause chaos and mayhem with his interfering and upsetting comments. Based on the Broadway hit by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart, and adapted for the screen by Julius and Philip Epstein. Cast includes Bette Davis, Ann Sheridan, Monty Woolley, Jimmy Durante, Billie Burke, Reginald Gardiner.

results.title: Grosse Pointe blank
results.creator_credit: George Armitage, Donna Roth, Roger Birnbaum, Susan Arnold and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Hilariously black romantic comedy about a hit man who returns to his home town and attends his high school reunion. Encountering a former flame, who he unceremoniously jilted several years earlier, Martin is caught between his dark past (that has followed him home) and his desire for something new with Debbie. Top cast includes John and Joan Cusack, Alarn Arkin, Minnie Driver and Dan Ackroyd.

results.title: Mysterious object at noon
results.creator_credit: Apichatpong Weerasethakul, Gridthiya Gaweewong, Mingmongkol Sonakul, 6 Cinema Factory, 9/6 Cinema Factory and Firecracker Films
results.brief_description: Drawing on the Surrealist storytelling technique known as Exquisite Corpse, wherein a variety of writers would contribute to a story one sentence at a time, without knowing much about what the previous sentences contained “Mysterious object at noon” is a fragmented, open-ended anti-narrative. Thai independent filmmaker Apichatpong Weerasethakul used the technique to interview people throughout Thailand, learning a little bit about their lives and then asking them to contribute to the film’s evolving story. What emerges is at once a portrait of Thailand’s disenfranchised lower classes - farmers, fruit vendors, village performers of “mor lam” (a song-and-storytelling hybrid extremely popular in the rural northeast) - and a fractured group-narration of a story about a handicapped boy and his tutor, a woman named Dogfar. The finished story was then shot in dramatic form, using nonprofessional actors, and intercut with the earlier footage. An experimental mix of documentary and fiction, this highly unusual and unconventional work challenges defined notions of authorship, authenticity, genre cinema and narrative.

results.title: Memento mori = Yeogo goedam
results.creator_credit: Min Kyu Dong, Tae-Yong Kim, Kim Sung-Jae and Cine 2000
results.brief_description: Two Korean teenagers - Hyo-shin and Shi-eun - are at the same all girl high school, in love, and sharing a diary of their affair. When Hyo-shin commits suicide, her classmates regard Shi-eun with suspicion. “Memento mori” depicts in flashback the origins of the affair and the background to the contents of the diary. A third classmate - Min-ah - discovers the diary and is drawn into their web of intrigue. Reading the diary in the hope of unravelling its secrets, Min-ah starts to hear voices and experience supernatural incidents. Shifting narrative perspectives suggests that its deceased owner may haunt the keeper of the diary. Wild dreamscape visuals drive the film, which depicts the social environment of the school as ruthless and bitchy. Bored with their studies and stupefied by the heat, the girls form gossipy groups with shifting loyalties. As outsiders, Hyo-shin and Shi-eun are targets for cruelty and taunting. Kim Tae-Yong and Min Kyu Dong direct their stylish debut thriller, which hints that mass hysteria may be all that is haunting the girls.

results.title: Varsity blues
results.creator_credit: Brian Robbins, Mike Tollin, Tova Laiter and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Eager to prove he is more than just another soap star, James Van Der Beek agreed to the title role of Jonathan “Mox” Moxton in this coming of age film set in Texas. Mox is a reluctant gridiron fullback in the West Canaan Coyotes who discovers his brilliance for the game after being called in to substitute for injured star player Lance Harbor (Paul Walker). Mox is not thrilled at being pushed into the limelight as it means undue attention from masochistic Coach Kilmer (Jon Voight) - eager to win the 23rd district trophy, increased pressure from his father who is using Mox to live out his own unfulfilled sporting aspirations, and grief from his girlfriend who says that Mox is deluding himself by being a football hero. Things come to a head on the eve of the final when Mox is blackmailed by Coach Kilmer into play the game “his way” or face the prospect of remaining in their one horse town when he sabotages Mox’s chance at taking up his university offer. Cast also includes Ron Lester, Scott Caan, Ali Larter and Amy Smart.

results.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
results.creator_credit: Mike Barker, Suzan Harrison, BBC, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Anne Bronte’s novel of an unhappy marriage deals with the themes of self-sacrifice, adulterous passion and redemption set amongst the rugged but beautiful landscape of the Yorkshire Dales. Helen Graham, a widow with a young son, is the new tenant of Wildfell Hall. Her radical views and her aloofness attracts the local young squire Gilbert Markham but despite the attraction, Helen has a secret which prevents their love from blossoming. Starring Tara Fitzgerald, Toby Stephens and Rupert Graves.

results.title: Moonlighting
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Mark Shivas, Centar Film and Michael White
results.brief_description: Three Polish builders and their foreman, Nowak, (Jeremy Irons), the only one to speak English, enter Britain illegally to renovate the home of a rich fellow Pole. All goes according to plan, but it is December 1981, time of the military crackdown in Poland and Nowak, the only one to find out, decides not to tell the others. Things start to go badly wrong, the workers are restless, money begins to run out, and Nowak resorts to increasingly desperate measures to keep everything under control. A Cannes Film Festival award winner.

results.title: Instinct
results.creator_credit: Jon Turteltaub, Barbara Boyle, Brian Doubleday, Christina Steinberg, Michael Taylor, Richard Lerner and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This psychological thriller is about an anthropologist, Ethan Powell, who leaves human society to live among gorillas. Fully ensconced in this animal world, Powell is extradited back to the United States after murdering two gorilla poachers. Once there, it falls to an ambitious psychiatrist to discover the non-communicative Powell’s secrets. With in-form performances by Anthony Hopkins and Cuba Gooding Jr, this film attempts with profundity to address human nature, harmony with the natural world, and what motivates passions bordering on insanity. Cast also includes Donald Sutherland.
